website_summaries.verdict: You don't have to wait to pique your young child's interest in building and basic engineering skills with this set that's specifically designed for little ones' hands and imaginations.
pros: An ideal K'NEX set for kids ages 3 to 5 thanks to the larger pieces that sport bright colors and soft material
Offers 66 pieces capable of making 30 models, and a storage case with lid that's easy for youngsters to open
cons: There's a bit of learning curve for pre-schoolers, but that's part of the fun
Some kids wish the wheels would spin

customer_reviews.title: Good toy, but environmentally clueless
customer_reviews.text: K'Nex makes good toys but over-packages in the extreme. In this set, some of the individual pieces (such as the eyes and feet) were individually wrapped in plastic, then put into a larger plastic bag with other pieces, which in turn was put into a display box that was 2 or 3 times bigger than necessary. That had been shipped individually to Amazon individually in a snugly-fitting brown box, which Amazon shipped to me in yet a far larger box. Surely, if they wanted to, the companies involved could reduce the environmental cost of all this. That said, it is fun, creative, and mostly sturdy. (The eyes, less so.)
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Alyson

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow, my kids love this! We use this for our homeschool classroom toy so the kids don't have free access to it. If they did, the pieces would be long-gone by now. My 4yo girl is a little builder and she enjoys this so much. Easy for kids to manage & handle. I wish it came with a tote or carrying case, though. I keep all the pieces in a zip lock bag inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: siggmak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit with plenty of pieces and eyes!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the Kid K'Nex kits! I've purchased multiple kits and this one is a particularly good value. Lots of pieces for the money, including several sets of eyes. When Legos are too advanced but you have a very tactile child who likes to build, these are an excellent choice. For us, we bought these for our 8 year old son who is developmentally delayed. He has excellent fine motor skills but doesn't have the endurance/patience for Legos or similar building kits. But he just loves these and they keep him engaged for hours. When I find an activity that engages my child for more than 15 minutes, it gets the highest possible rating!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but you need multiple sets
customer_reviews.text: You need multiple sets in order to make anything really worthwhile. Also, these are so similar to my kids' Tinker Toys that they all got mixed up within a day or two, but thankfully many of the parts are interchangeable. Altogether somewhat disappointing. I love building sets for my kids, as they provide so much open-ended creative possibilities, but these are unremarkable and I won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LucieBlue

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Same size as my partial set from the 80s or 90s! Very well made and durable. One set is going to work for one kid without a lot of leftover parts after building something. So, if you have more kids id get about two sets min. for every 3 kids that are going to build together. That said these will last for all eternity even in a daycare like setting and are super fun so worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Love love love - Great gift for a 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: We just love love love our K'Nex! There are so many ways to create and build with these and have hours of fun. Perfect for a 3 year old to a 4 year old. I only wish the set came with more eyeballs (it only comes with two sets of eyes) and that all the pieces were bendy (only some are). I love that the creations always come out looking super goofy. I feel that it gives my normally-quite-serious son a chance to let loose, think outside the box, and just get silly. This is a great starter set for someone who does not have any other K'Nex yet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 20BIGRED02

customer_reviews.title: Loads of creative fun
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this kit. Super easy for little hands and imaginations. The "storage box" mentioned in the description is nothing more than the cardboard packaging, though. No actual storage container. Just a flimsy box that has already been torn.
customer_reviews.author: Amber R

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toys ever.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, educational, and fun! Everything you want in a toy! I'm a 2nd grade teacher & have bought several of these as gifts for family members. I use them to teach physical science in class.
customer_reviews.author: Beetscor

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying More Than One Set of These!
customer_reviews.text: These are SO awesome we are buying another set! All 3 of my kids (ages 2-6) enjoy playing with these but the set is not really large enough for them to share peacefully...limited pieces to make all the modeled creations. We eventually want to purchase 2 more sets!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nail

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for him for Christmas. He's not only made all the things the booklet shows, but many new ideas as well. He loves building things and plays with this and his other building toys all the time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toy specially for active boys who doesn't sit. But the only problem with my 5 year old son is that he started to play and loose them everywhere, therefore I suggest that and adult sits with him until he finishes and keep it away. It is very easy and flexible to connect. It is not for kids under 4 years because it has some small pieces.

customer_reviews.text: This has been kid tested and as much as they love to put things together and build these are not a favorite-- because they come with no pictures of possibilities nor directions

customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 4 year old for a Christmas present. It's great for that age. He feels like he can build like his big brothers but these are much easier to put together than legos. He is really enjoying them.

customer_reviews.title: This was my 4-year-old son's favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This Kid K'nex set is ideal for the 3-4 year old set, and even older! This was my 4-year-old son's favorite Christmas gift, and even his 8-year-old sister loves to play along with him. The pieces are bigger than traditional K'nex and very durable. The kit includes an instruction sheet with 30 or so different ideas that are easy enough for little ones to make on their own without assistance from a grown-up.

customer_reviews.title: My 4 yr old loved this!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for my 4 yr old. It allowed him to be creative and he would spend a great deal of time creating various creatures. The product arrived on time and is reasonably priced. I would definitely buy this brand again.

It would be a fun starter set for someone, but I would suggest using it with some other sets with more pieces for kids to really be able to get creative. The Kid K'Nex products are fabulous for all 3 of my kids, ages 2, 4 & 6. They have a blast building with them and they get their brains going and have fun at the same time! I highly recommend these!

He loves them, they are bigger then the normal ones and that works out great for him. Its fun watching all the crazy things he comes up with to build with these.

product_meta.title: KID K’NEX – Build A Bunch Set – 66 Pieces – For Ages 3+ Construction  Educational Toy (Amazon Exclusive), packaging may vary
product_meta.description:
Kids will create fun and friendly creatures with the KID K’NEX Build a Bunch Set. It contains 66 soft, colorful, and chunky rods and connectors that easily stack, snap, and plug together. This set contains fun and unique parts such as wheels, eyes, and tails to bring your child’s creations to life. The chunky, multicolored pieces are perfect for young minds and little hands.

Children will enjoy building 30 different models, including a colorful airplane, a train, bugs, animals, underwater creatures, and more. Let them stretch the limits of their imagination while developing important cognitive and motor skills.

The KID K’NEX Build a Bunch Set is carefully packaged in a handy, easy-to-open box for effortless storage and portability. All the parts can be quickly stored in this durable container. Once playtime is over, just place the parts in the handy storage box for a quick and easy cleanup. No need to worry about stray and missing pieces when they’re all in one place.

Building STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts, and math) skills by igniting a preschooler’s natural curiosity and creativity powers the fun of every KID K’NEX building set. Building with K’NEX puts preschoolers on the path to a fundamental understanding of STEAM subjects.

K’NEX supports key areas of a preschooler’s developmental growth. As they click the different parts together and discover how the building system works, they’re strengthening hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills, problem-solving skills, and spatial awareness, all while exercising their imaginations!

Learning while playing enhances young ones’ cognitive abilities and creativity. Let your kids explore their young imaginations by discovering diverse ways to create an array of fun and colorful models with KID K’NEX Build a Bunch Set.

feature_bullets: 66 CHUNKY PIECES –Create fun and friendly creatures with the KID K’NEX Build a Bunch Set. It contains 66 soft, colorful, and chunky rods and connectors that easily stack, snap, and plug together. Plus, fun and unique parts such as wheels, eyes, and tails will bring your child’s creations to life. This set includes chunky multicolored pieces that are perfect for young minds and little hands.

30 BUILDING IDEAS – Your child will have fun building 30 different models, including a colorful airplane, a train, bugs, animals, underwater creatures, and more. Let your little ones explore their young imaginations by discovering how to build colorful creations on their own.

COMES WITH IDEA SHEET – Children will piece together the chunky and colorful KID K’NEX rods, connectors, wheels, eyes, and tails for hours. A poster-sized sheet is included for the 30 building ideas you can make with this set. Guide your preschooler in assembling vehicles, bugs, animals, and other creatures during playtime.

CONVENIENT STORAGE – The KID K’NEX Build a Bunch Set is carefully packaged in a handy, easy-open box for effortless storage and portability. Everything can be easily and quickly stored in this durable container. Once playtime is over, place the parts in the handy storage box for a quick and easy cleanup. Packaging may vary.

STEAMagination: It’s the connection of STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts & math) with a preschooler’s natural curiosity and creativity and it powers the fun of each and every KID K’NEX building set. Building with KID K’NEX puts preschoolers on a path towards a fundamental understanding of STEAM/STEM subjects.

DEVELOPMENTAL BENEFITS: KID K’NEX supports key areas of a preschooler’s developmental growth. As they click the different parts together and discover how the building system works, they’re strengthening hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills, problem-solving skills, spatial awareness and exercising their imagination!

COMMITMENT TO QUALITY: KID K’NEX rods and connectors are responsibly made in America at a landfill-free, zero-waste green manufacturing facility in Hatfield, Pennsylvania. We test to the strictest quality and safety standards, ensuring that your child has a successful, trouble-free building experience.

PARTS GUARANTEE: Broken part? Missing part? If you find yourself in need of a replacement for any reason, just give us a call! We’ll get you what you need so that your child can get back to building as soon as possible.
